argo.rule_application.rule_application.sim_rule_applier module¶

Class for applying rules using the sim_ll column

class argo.rule_application.rule_application.sim_rule_applier.SimRuleApplier(opt_func=None, sim_ll_column='sim_ll', rules=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Applies a set of system rules to a dataset (which are applied by flattening the sim_ll column).

rule_descriptions¶

Contains the logic of the rules and heir performance metrics as applied to the dataset.

Type

pd.Dataframe

rules_not_in_sim_ll¶

List of rule names that were provided in the rules class constructor parameter but could not be found in the sim_ll column.

Type

list

apply(X: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, y=None, sample_weight=None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Applies a set of system rules to the dataset X (using the sim_ll column). If y is provided, the performance metrics for each rule will also be calculated.

Parameters

  • X (pd.Dataframe) – The dataset containing the sim_ll column.

  • y (pd.Series, optional) – The target column. Defaults to None.

  • sample_weight (pd.Series, optional) – Record-wise weights to apply. Defaults to None.

Returns

Contains the binary columns for each rule, which

dictate whether the rule has triggered (i.e. value is 1) for a particular record.

Return type

pd.DataFrame
